page.title: 11HISTORY: TEDSTONE DELAMERE
page.content: At partly moated Woodmanton Farm there are the remains of a former Chapel now a farm building. The Chapel had an impressive roof, it was a timber wagon vault, and can be connected with a date of 1332,when a licence to crennallate was granted. The Chapel also has a timber window of two lights with ogee-trefoiled heads. The ground floor at some time was converted into the farm kitchen,with a chimneystack built right up through the upper part of the Chapel. The first floor is a seventeenth century insertion. The roof is more or less complete over two bays and is a wagon vault. It is an example of a rafter roof with curved ashlar pieces, originally supported by a timber substructure.
